data.title: All about "ER" - Season 14 Quiz
data.meta_description: This quiz is on season 14 of ER. Just how much do you remember? - test your knowledge in this quiz! (Author poshprice)
data.text:
Quiz Answer Key and Fun Facts

1. The very first episode of this season revealed that the position of ER chief had been given to Pratt.

Answer: False

The fourteenth season of "ER" kicked off with a completely new face in charge of the ER. Following the resignation of Luka Kova√®, a new ER chief took the reigns, in the form of new doctor, Kevin Moretti. This caused quite a stir in the ER and quite a few of the staff resented the changes made by Moretti. Greg Pratt was particularly annoyed that the Chief of Staff, Donald Anspaugh, had not considered him for the position.

In fact the position of ER chief was a role that Pratt strived for throughout the entire season.

2. What type of rally was Neela attending when she sustained severe crush injures?

Answer: An anti-war rally

At the beginning of this season Neela sustained serious crush injuries after being trampled on at an anti-war rally. Neela was eventually brought to the ER, where she was operated on by Lucien Dubenko, who saved her life.

3. To which department was Tony Gates temporarily banished, in order to learn some control?

Answer: The Intensive Care Unit (ICU)

After Gates lost his temper in the ER and attacked a patient, Moretti reassigned him temporarily to the ICU. Despite Gates' protestations, Moretti insisted that he needed to learn some control, and pointed out that the ICU was the best place for him to do so. Although initially skeptical, Gates excelled in the ICU, and eventually returned to the ER a much more controlled and humble man.

4. What did Abby do in this season which led to Luka moving out of the family home?

Answer: She cheated on him

During this season, Abby's alcoholism resurfaced again, following an accident involving her son, Joe. With Luka in Croatia, Abby relied more and more on alcohol in order to get her through the day, even going so far as turning up drunk to work. During an ER night out, an inebriated Abby slept with Kevin Moretti, causing her to feel intense guilt. Even after admitting to Luka that she needed help with her alcoholism, Abby did not tell him about her one night stand with Moretti.

However after coming out of rehab, Abby did reveal the truth to a devastated Luka. Near the end of this season, Luka moved out of the home they shared as a family, because he could not deal with Abby's revelation.

5. Two of "ER's" main characters lost their fathers during the course of this season. Who were they?

Answer: Archie Morris and Luka Kovac

Sadly for both Archie and Luka, their fathers died during the course of this season. However while Luka spent a great deal of this season in Croatia with his father, before he died, Archie did not get the chance to see his. In fact Archie later revealed to Sam that he and his father had never seen eye to eye, despite Archie's attempts to make him proud.

6. With whom did Tony Gates start a relationship during this season?

Answer: Samantha Taggart

Tony and Sam started to get close in this season, which eventually led to them starting a relationship. However they did keep their relationship a secret for a while, which led to one particularly embarrassing scene in which a dvd recording of one of their private moments was passed around the ER.

7. A familiar face reappeared as the mother of a patient in this season. Which ex ER worker was it that made a brief return?

Answer: Jeanie Boulet

HIV positive, ex-physician's assistant, Jeanie Boulet, made a special appearance in this season of "ER", in order to seek medical help for her HIV positive son, Carlos. In the years since leaving the ER, she revealed that she and her husband, Reggie had separated, and her first husband, Al, had died two years previously.

Initially, it was thought that Carlos was fine, but it was eventually revealed that he had a growth on his brain, prompting the doctors to fear that he had developed full blown AIDS.

8. In which of the following establishments did Luka end up working?

Answer: A hospice

Following Luka and Abby's marital problems, the former took a job working as a physician in a local hospice. Without discussing the matter with his wife, Luka took the job in an attempt to come to terms with the difficulties in his personal life. While working at this hospice, Luka developed a strong bond with one of the patients, an elderly man who taught him a great deal about forgiveness.

9. Midway through this season, a handsome, but arrogant new attending joined the ER. Ruffling feathers immediately with his unwillingness to teach, he proved to be quite the Casanova. What country did this doctor come from?

Answer: Australia

Midway through this season, Australian, Dr. Simon Brenner, joined the ER, as the new attending physician. Presented as a womaniser and an egotist, he angered Greg Pratt immediately by refusing to teach most interns, because he thought it was a waste of time.

However Pratt was left with egg on his face after complaining about Brenner to Donald Anspaugh, who turned out to be Brenner's uncle.

10. Ever since first joining the ER, Tony Gates was known for referring to Neela as "Mayday". However in this season viewers finally found out why. What was the reason for this nickname?

Answer: It was the name of Tony's favourite Bond girl

During the course of this season, Gates finally explained to Neela why he had nicknamed her "Mayday". During the pair's first meeting since Neela's accident, Tony revealed to her that the nickname "Mayday" came from his favourite Bond girl. According to Gates, Mayday appeared in "A View to Kill", and ended up saving the world.

Source: Author poshprice

This quiz was reviewed by FunTrivia editor ladymacb29 before going online.

Any errors found in FunTrivia content are routinely corrected through our feedback system.
